speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe when you first started experiencing double vision and if it has worsened over time?

speaker: Patient
text: I first noticed the double vision about a month ago. It has definitely gotten worse, especially after I've been active or tired.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty swallowing or speaking since the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any trouble swallowing or speaking. It's mainly just the double vision and weakness in my arms.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your facial muscles, such as drooping or weakness?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any drooping, but sometimes my facial muscles feel a bit weak, especially when I'm tired.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fatigue or muscle weakness that worsens with activity, or do you feel weak even at rest?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I definitely feel more fatigued and weak after doing any physical activity. It improves quite a bit after I rest for a while.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections or illnesses prior to the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses. I felt completely fine before the double vision and weakness started.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your reflexes or coordination, such as stumbling or difficulty with fine motor tasks?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my reflexes or coordination. I can still manage fine motor tasks, but I do feel a bit clumsier when I'm tired.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any muscle cramps or twitching in your arms or legs?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any muscle cramps or twitching in my arms or legs. It's mainly just the weakness and double vision that I'm dealing with.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any previous medical conditions or family history of autoimmune diseases or neuromuscular disorders?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any significant past medical history, and there's no family history of autoimmune diseases or neuromuscular disorders that I'm aware of.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your vision aside from the double vision, such as blurriness or difficulty focusing?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any blurriness or difficulty focusing, it's just the double vision that I'm experiencing. It feels like everything is doubled, but my vision itself is clear otherwise.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of weakness that come and go, or is the weakness in your arms constant?

speaker: Patient
text: The weakness in my arms isn't constant; it tends to come and go. It gets worse after I've been active, but it improves quite a bit after I rest.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your breathing, such as shortness of breath or difficulty taking deep breaths, especially after physical activity?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any shortness of breath or difficulty breathing. My breathing feels normal, even after physical activity.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your skin, such as rashes or unusual sensations?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my skin, no rashes or unusual sensations. Everything seems normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or changes in medication that could be related to your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations, and I haven't changed any medications either. Everything has been the same as it was before my symptoms started.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of dizziness or lightheadedness along with your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any dizziness or lightheadedness. It's mainly just the double vision and weakness that I've been dealing with.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your ability to chew or control your facial expressions, especially when you're tired?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my ability to chew or control my facial expressions. They feel normal, but I do feel a bit more fatigued when I'm tired.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent weight loss or changes in appetite?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any weight loss or changes in my appetite. My eating habits have remained the same throughout this time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests done, particularly looking for antibodies or markers related to autoimmune conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any recent blood tests done. I haven't been to the doctor for anything like that since my symptoms started.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Antibody_Testing_for_Autoimmune_Disorders. Can you tell me if you have experienced any changes in your sleep patterns or overall mood since the onset of your symptoms?

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: It’s good to hear that your antibody testing came back normal. Have you noticed any specific triggers that seem to worsen your symptoms, such as stress or certain activities?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed that physical activity tends to trigger my symptoms, especially when I'm climbing stairs or doing anything that requires upper body strength. Stress doesn't seem to have much of an effect, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms of double vision, muscle weakness that worsens with activity, and the normal antibody testing, it sounds like you may be experiencing myasthenia gravis. DIAGNOSIS READY: Myasthenia Gravis.
